author: Special Correspondent
text:
Puthiya Tamizhagam (PT) will take a final call on alliance for the election after ascertaining views and suggestions from the party’s rank and file, its leader K. Krishnasamy said on Wednesday.

The party has already kicked off this exercise by organising meetings at the district level with field-level workers, Mr. Krishnasamy said here.

Speaking to reporters after holding a meeting with Tiruchi district party functionaries here, Mr. Krishnasamy claimed that the party had no hidden agenda and that it had an open mind as of now on poll alliance.

He said a decision on alliance would be taken only after the election date was announced and after holding a meeting with district secretaries in March first week.

Stating that the PT favoured a “change,” he said all aspects would be looked into prior to taking a final call on the alliance issue.

On the issue relating to Justice C.S. Karnan of the Madras High Court, Mr. Krishnasamy termed the developments as unfortunate.

He alleged that Tamil Nadu was a hot bed of human rights violations and honour killings.

He urged the State government to initiate talks with the government employees and noon meal workers who have been protesting in support of their charter of demands over the past few days.
title: Krishnasamy to ascertain views of cadre on alliance
